critique: This document revokes previous orders creating power-site reserves in Idaho. It's primarily concerned with land management and resource allocation. There's no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, executive power expansion, or impacts on civil liberties. It seems to favor deregulation by opening up land previously reserved for power sites, and has no impact on social inclusion. Federalism is difficult to assess without knowing the original context of the power-site reserves, but I will assume it is neutral.
